page.title: 06BOLDRE MEMORIAL HALL
page.content: The Boldre Memorial Hall was built just after the 1st World War,with the enthusiastic encouragement of the Perkins family <also responsible in the 1st instance for the W.I.> An extention was added in the 50's and another in the 80's.Extensive repairs <the roof was damaged when the hall served as a cinema during the war> have brought it in line with the most recent regulations and it is in constant use all the time.The play School uses it all week,the W.I,the Tug-of-War team,the Darby and Joan Club,the Parish Council,the Needlework Guild all use it regularly.It is the venue for Jumble Sales,Bazaars Discos,parties,tea dances,band practise,whist drives and wedding receptions throughout the year.During the summer it becomes the H.Q.for Guide and Scout camps.
